div.p: Watch life; what it is to actually be on watch... I don’t mean it in a negative way but yeah they didn’t really tell you what watch life
was like so you sort of had a very vague idea of what it was going to be like once you go into station but not exactly how it would be
which was probably part of the surprise to be honest because, you know, all said and done I was very, very excited once I got my station post
and I remember like the first 2 days before I started, so 2 days prior, and I remember saying “I start work soon”
“I start work soon” because I was going to be on station, I was going to be like a real Fire Fighter and everyone was like
“you’re excited to be going to work?” and I was like “yeah” because you know I was starting a new role and then once you started
that faded but I do enjoy the job, the job itself, I wouldn’t do anything different
